snippet: Dennis Holt, who died in June, was a longtime reporter for Brooklyn newspapers, and, his friends discovered, an activist for civil rights in Alabama.
abstract: Kevin Baker article pays tribute to the late Dennis Holt, a longtime reporter for Brooklyn community newspapers and champion of Brooklyn during its darker days; after his death, friends learned of a surprise in Holt's past--that he had been an early civil rights activist who led a successful effort to quash an anti-desegregation riot at the University of Alabama in 1956.
lead_paragraph: Dennis Holt, who died in June, was a longtime reporter for Brooklyn newspapers, and, his friends discovered, an activist for civil rights in Alabama.

headline.seo: Memories of Dennis Holt, Who Championed Brooklyn and Reported on It
headline.main: In Brooklyn, a Friend Is a Hero in Disguise
headline.print_headline: In Brooklyn, A Friend Is a Hero In Disguise
